我已经在本机的centos7.2.1511环境测试过运行正常，可能跟你部署在阿里云上的环境有关系。建议直接修改启动collector-service.sh脚本。修改内容如下
```
#
#eval exec "\"$_RUNJAVA\" ${JAVA_OPTS} -classpath $CLASSPATH org.skywalking.apm.collector.worker.CollectorBootStartUp \
#        2>${COLLECTOR_LOGS_DIR}/collector.log 1> /dev/null &"

$_RUNJAVA ${JAVA_OPTS} -classpath $CLASSPATH org.skywalking.apm.collector.worker.CollectorBootStartUp \
        2>${COLLECTOR_LOGS_DIR}/collector.log 1> /dev/null &
```
是否和具体的小版本和安装的命令环境有关？
@wu-sheng 没有关系，我目前安装的版本和提供的版本是一致的。我在环境上除了修改了JAVA_HOME之外其他都没有修改过。

In this week, I change a lot of agent codes, refactor actually, as a result, sky-walking agent can ignore and sample trace in high performance. Also, it provided the mechanism to support analytic trace in the further.

These are new features:
1. Remove the three maps of tag. This is be benifit for reducing cost and gc.
1. Ignore request with certain suffix, such as: .css, .js, .png, etc.
1. Adjust sampling mechanism for better performance. The new is: all segments are sampled, which changes to unsampled, iff 1) sampling is on, 2) no segment-refs, 3) can't get the sampling factor. When this trace status changes to **unsampled**, the context switch to **IgnoredTracerContext**, which will provide higher performance.
@ascrutae @pengys5 You can review this pr now. This is a major improvement in 3.2

3.2 研发版本，已经提供忽略特性，并提供更高效和稳定的采样机制。
Replaced by #234.

First thing first, we should support three types span in tracer context, **Entry**, **Exit**( Replace `leaf` ) and **Local**. Each one of them has different characteristics.
1. **Entry Span**, based stack-depth structure, one instance covers multi inject-points in a trace context. Begin at every service provider, like Tomcat plugin. When the second **Entry Span** is asked to create, just increase the stack depth, instead of creating new span. But will reset the span data, except start time.
1. **Exit Span**, just like what **Leaf Span** did, right now. Record data in the first leaf, ignore others belong to it.
1. **Local Span**, like the recent **Span**, do what to be asked.

In span, `peer, port, peers` will be replaced by `peer` once for all, to avoid to check these three field but no benefit.

Because of adding these three types of span, we  have to face the situation, which is How to be an OpenTracing supported tracer. Here is my proposals:
1. `SkyWalkingSpan` construction needs `span.type`, otherwise throws exception. Users must set this tag by `SkyWalkingSpanBuilder.withTag`.
1. The opentracing `SkyWalkingSpan` interceptor creates **Real Span** by this tag.
1. Forbid to reset `span.type` by `SkyWalkingSpan.setTag`.

By doing these, seem all things are in the same system, again. 😊

## Register serviceName, applicationCode and Network address.
* **ServiceName** is a subset of span's operationName. It only used when the span is type of **Entry** or **Exist**. So **serviceName** didn't contain hostname, ip, port or anything about machine or network, just as same as a concept of naming in micro-service background.
* **ApplicationCode** is set by agent user for grouping the application.
* **Network address** including hostname, ipv4, ipv6, cluster-ip-group( `ip1:port1,ip2:port2` ) and port.

For improving performance for uplink segment and analytic traces, and also reducing the cost of tracing-context cross-thread/process propagation. New Agent will send these two to collector for exchanging integers, which represent them.

Following these rules:
1. Same **Identify** for **ServiceName**, iff the **SericeName** and **Application Code** are same.
1. Same **Identify** for each **ApplicationCode**.
1. Same **Identify** for **Network address**, if literaly same. Only if it is a cluster-ip-group, the collector should split by `,` and sort the ip array, then compare for equal.

Here are some examples:

| Application Code| Identify (Integer Represent)| Actual Type| Actual Value|
| :------------- |:-------------:|:-----:|:-----:|
| ProdApp  | 1 | serviceName | /prod/rest/order|
| AcountApp | 5 | serviceName | /prod/rest/order ( Unlikely naming like this, just for demonstration) |
| ProdApp  | 2 | network | 291.168.3.56:3007|
| AcountApp | 2 | network | 291.168.3.56:3007|
| AcountApp | 3 | network | 10.238.3.5:7001,10.238.3.5:7002 |
| ProdApp  | 3 | network | 10.238.3.5:7002,10.238.3.5:7001 |
| ProdApp  | 4 | network | 10.238.3.5:7001,10.238.3.5:7002,10.238.3.5:7003

## New cross-propagation protocol
Here is the 3.1 [cross-process propagation data structure](https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/blob/ff7c7e51968f51a8eabd15d9ab90f086d4ebf4ed/apm-sniffer/apm-agent-core/src/main/java/org/skywalking/apm/agent/core/context/trace/TraceSegmentRef.java). 

Through considering **Register serviceName and Network address** feature. 

In 3.1, the propagation is like this:
```
parent_segment_id|parent_span_id|CLIENT_APP_CODE|10.2.3.16:8080|Trace.global.id.123,Trace.global.id.222
```

My proposal for 3.3, just an example
```
1. Parent_segment_id
2. Parent_span_id 
3. Application id (Integer) of client side
4. Network id of server id, which from client side. Or String, if dictionary doesn't exist, yet.
5. EntryOperationName id. Or string, if dictionary doesn't exist, yet.
6. Global trace ids
```

The purpose of this is for reducing the size of cross-process propagation data, even added the service chain, but still shorter than the old( v3.1 ) one.

**Already included** 
~~3. Compress serviceName, peer, port, peers.~~
~~4. New ref structure of SegmentTrace.~~

**Updated at 28th April**, by @wu-sheng
**Topological graph of service** will depend on segment-cycle analysis. The earlier design use head to propagate service chain has many disadvantages, such as too much cost for in-bound communication, and still can't analysis the whole service topological.

**Updated at 2nd June**, by @wu-sheng
**New** cross-process propagation format.

cc @ascrutae @pengys5

Provided 5 GRPC services definition:
1. [TraceSegmentService](https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/blob/feature/high-performance-agent/apm-network/src/main/proto/TraceSegmentService.proto): Actual trace segment receive service.
1. [RegisterService](https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/blob/feature/high-performance-agent/apm-network/src/main/proto/RegisterService.proto): Ask for application id and instance id, at starting stage, before other services.
1. [JVMMetricsService](https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/blob/feature/high-performance-agent/apm-network/src/main/proto/JVMMetricsService.proto): Not finished yet, uplink jvm info about GC, memory, CPU in certain cycle, maybe per 15 seconds .

cc @pengys5 @ascrutae
What is this pr for? Accordding to the change logs, it didn't contain any your codes. @wuce7758
Closing this..
In 3.3, we have decided to use GRPC for improving performance. Check here: https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/issues/236#issuecomment-310268231

Because kafka didn't have **Head** concept, the cross-process propagation has to inject data into the message. Which must trigger consuming message fail, the no-agent is at consumer side.

According to this, we set the kafka plugin **off** as default. User must open this plugin explicitly.

@pengys5 From my understanding, I am pretty sure, BUS is for config and management instructions, which is based on Spring Stream. And they are all based on MQ itself.
After we provide plugins for RabbitMQ and Kafka, we can support all above.
